TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SqlCacheDependencyDatabaseCollection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencySection> uses the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencyDatabaseCollection> to programmatically access and modify the `databases` element of the `sqlCacheDependency` in the `cache` configuration section.
## Examples The following code example shows how to obtain a <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencyDatabaseCollection> object by accessing the `sqlCacheDependency` section of a configuration file.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencyDatabaseCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencyDatabaseCollection/CS/sqlcachedependencydatabasecollection.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencyDatabaseCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencyDatabaseCollection/VB/sqlcachedependencydatabasecollection.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencyDatabaseCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencyDatabaseCollection> class by using the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SqlCacheDependencySection.Databases%2A> property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method inserts a `clear` directive into the appropriate section of the configuration file to remove all references to elements defined in a higher-level configuration file.
